items.title:
Going from Architect to Architecting:
the Evolution of a Key Role
items.description: This article explores the cultural change of moving towards shared architecture, and the role that the architect has evolved into. Teams might be struggling with the paradigm shift of ownership.
items.author: InfoQ

items.title: Scaling the Practice of Architecture, Conversationally
items.description: Scaling architecture through a structured series of conversations
items.author: Martin Fowler

items.title: Event Driven Architecture - The Complete Guide
items.description: Become an expert in one of the most popular Software Architecture styles in the world!

items.description: A Gartner roadmap for how enterprise architects can succeed in their new role.
items.author: Gartner

items.title: 14 software architecture design patterns to know
items.description: Architectural patterns increase your productivity: These reusable schemes address common software design challenges.
items.author: RedHat

items.title: 10 nonfunctional requirements to consider in your enterprise architecture
items.description: Nonfunctional requirements define how a system is supposed to operate, rather than what it's supposed to do, but they still play a vital role in meeting end-users' needs.
items.author: RedHat

items.title: 5 things enterprise architects should know about microservices
items.description: Microservices are a key part of today's IT environment, and there are five things every enterprise architect should know about them. Six things, if one counts how they are similar to managing rabbit hutches.
items.author: RedHat

items.title: How to create architectural guidelines that work
items.description: Architectural guidelines go beyond documentation to show users how to use all the features and capabilities built into technologies.
items.author: RedHat

items.title: Event-driven architecture for microservices
items.description: What, Why and How. Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) is a way of designing applications and services to respond to real-time information based on the sending and receiving of information about individual event notifications.
items.author: RedHat

items.title: Domain Driven Design
items.description: Domain-Driven Design is an approach to software development that centers the development on programming a domain model that has a rich understanding of the processes and rules of a domain.
items.author: Martin Fowler

items.title: What are the differences between enterprise architecture styles, patterns, and design patterns?
items.description: Compare architectural styles, patterns, and design patterns, and get some real-world guidance in our top 15 design articles of 2022.
items.author: RedHat
